newsitem.title: CHINA: China urban wages rise five percent.
newsitem.headline: China urban wages rise five percent.

text.p: The average wage of China's urban workers reached 4,003 yuan ($482) in the first nine months of this year, up an inflation-adjusted five percent from the same period in 1995, the China Securities said on Saturday.
The newspaper said the total spent on urban workers' wages in the first nine months was 593.5 billion yuan, up 14.4 percent.

Of this total, the amount spent on wages of workers in state-owned units totalled 458.7 billion yuan, up 14 percent, while wages of workers in rural industries totalled 85.3 billion yuan, rising 9.2 percent.
The total for workers in the non-state sector rose by 29.1 percent to 49.49 billion yuan, the newspaper said. ($1 = 8.3 yuan)
